title: Colliding Conversations 4
collaborators: Byron Mallett Kieran Carnegie Matt Plummer Nathan Stewart
projectBrief: Computing meets Design: Kieran Carnegie and Byron Mallet discuss how VR is being used today.

collaborators: Ocean Mercier Marc Aurel Schnabel Matt Plummer Nathan
schools: te kawa a maui architecture its its
projectBrief: Architecture meets Te Kawa a M?ui: Prof. Marc Aurel Schnabel and Dr Ocean Mercer discuss how virtual reality and augmented reality affect the world.

title: Colliding Conversations 1
collaborators: Neil Dodgson Miriam Ross Matt Plummer Nathan Stewart
projectBrief: Film meets Engineering: Dr Miriam Ross and Prof. Neil Dodgson discuss the past, present, and future of virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality.

title: Colliding Conversations 3
collaborators: Andre Geldenhuis Christopher Maymon Matt Plummer Nathan Stewart
projectBrief: Technology meets Psychology: Andre Geldenhuis and Christopher Maymon discuss how people react to VR.

title: Colliding Conversations 2
collaborators: Geoffrey Batchen Raqi Syed Matt Plummer Nathan Stewart
projectBrief: Design meets Art History: Dr Raqi Syed and Prof. Geoffrey Batchen discuss the pre-history and recent history of VR innovation.

title: Circle v Square
collaborators: Raqi Syed Miriam Ross
projectBrief: An experimental live action cinematic virtual reality production

title: HDI4D
collaborators: Taehyn Rhee Miriam Ross Kevin Romond Kieran Carnegie
projectBrief: Human-Digital Content Interaction for Immersive 4D Home Entertainment

title: LitAtlas
collaborators: Sydney Shep Matt Plummer Jonathon Bishop Jeff Jones Seb Paz Walter Langelaar
schools: wai te ata press its design
projectBrief: This short video captures the development of the Literary Atlas mobile app. The app combines geolocation and augmented reality tools to create a digitally interactive component to the Writers' Walk.

title: VR in Humanities
collaborators: Miriam Ross Joseph Hedren
projectBrief: VR in Humanities aims to provide a survey of the state of humanities focused VR literature as of 2017, identifying several emergent themes in this burgeoning field, as well as providing a selection of exemplary virtual reality experiences at the present time.

title: Virtual World Lab
collaborators: Leon Gurevitch Byron Mallett Raqi Syed
projectBrief: New developments with Virtual Reality technology highlight a vast territory for immersive storytelling, gaming, and many other forms of interactive experiences such as simulated education, medical therapy, and scientific visualization. At the lab, Design staff and students research new methods for storytelling, interaction, and immersive experience, presented via emerging technologies.

title: Yasawa Island Virtual Tourism
collaborators: Christian Schott Jonathan Flutey Andre Geldenhuis
projectBrief: Prototype VR-based virtual fieldtrip to the Fijian Island of Yasawa, which demonstrates an innovative and carbon-sensitive type of (educational) travel.

title: Stereoscopic Media
collaborators: Miriam Ross Leon Gurevitch
projectBrief: Stereoscopic Media is dedicated to the dissemination of academic research in the humanities on all forms of stereoscopic media: photography, cinema, computer games and other new media. It was initiated by Dr. Miriam Ross and Dr. Leon Gurevitch in 2011 with the aim of bringing together high quality critical thought and investigation of past and present 3D processes.

title: AR Rhino
collaborators: Jono Bishop Stefan Peacock Jeff Jones
projectBrief: An app utilising AR technology and game-play theory to teach the politics and psychology of poaching and conservation.

title: MRX
collaborators: Taehyun Rhee Andrew Chalmers Kieran Carnegie Benjamin Allen Lohit Petikam
projectBrief: MR360: Mixed Reality Rendering for 360° Panoramic Videos

title: Until Jesse
collaborators: Miriam Ross Joseph Hedren Raqi Syed Kevin Romond
projectBrief: Until Jesse 360 is a 360-degree short cinematic film that is best experienced in VR headsets such as the Vive, Oculus Rift or Samsung Gear.

title: Colliding Worlds
collaborators: Neil Dodgson Miriam Ross Matt Plummer Nathan Stewart
projectBrief: This project stages a suite of colliding conversations that explore how Victoria staff and students are contribution to the hot topics in virtual reality and digital creation.

title: Trash Praxis
collaborators: Raqi Syed Kevin Romond Alfio Leotta
projectBrief: A performance-captured, computer-generated talk show experience

title: Virtual Reality Showcase
collaborators: T.J. Moletta Douglas Easterly Leon Gurevitch
projectBrief: A Te Papa Talks even run in concert with the VUW Digital Futures theme, showcasing current thinking and practice in VR/AR filmmaking and creative enterprise.

title: Dream Flux
collaborators: Taehyun Rhee Andrew Chalmers Lohit Petikam
projectBrief: Immersive lighting and composition for VR, AR & MR wich seamlessly blends digital content with 360 videos.

title: ModRule
collaborators: Sky Lo Tian Tian Marc Aurel Schnabel T.J. Moletta
projectBrief: Sky Lo's research utilises VR and gamification to investigate the possibility for the participatory design of residential buildings in a high-rise, high-density urban context.

title: Junk Yard
collaborators: Jeff Jones Byron Mallett
projectBrief: Medis Design undergraduate project utilsing the Oculus Rift and Leap Motion to give a sense of presence.

title: Pensato
collaborators: Byron Mallett
projectBrief: Pensato is a Virtual Reality controller for performing music with Ableton Live. Performers can load any Ableton Live set they wish into the VR environment which will react to the outgoing music.
